page.title: 07TRANSPORT IN LITTONDALE
page.content: There is only one bus service which comes to Littondale. This is the one from Skipton to Buckden, which makes a detour to Arncliffe on a Monday and Friday only. The bus calls twice on each of these days, once at about 9.30 a.m. and again at about 1.30 p.m. There is no other public transport service to Littondale. A school bus takes children to and from the Primary School each day, and continues downs to Grassington with the secondary school children. The main road runs up the south side of the Dale through Arncliffe, then on to Litton, Halton Gill and Foxup. It is an unclassified off-shoot of the B6160, and it is joined at Arncliffe by a single track road running up the North side of the valley from the B6160. Single track roads leave the Dale from Arncliffe and Halton Gill.
